item.title: Performance of the different ways to swap two values
item.description: Swapping values is probably one of the simplest algorithms which can be imagined - we learn about it when starting our programming story. There are two popular ways to accomplish this: using a temporary variable and XORing (with some restrictions). In the newest C# versions there is also a third way, about which you can read in this article.
